climbs.name: Sole Sacrifice
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: Work up to a grey and tan streaked face to a stance below a small roof. Negotiate this and two more roofs including a crux move over the last roof just below the anchors.

climbs.name: Upside Down
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle; 2020

content.description: Stick clip first bolt or clip the first bolt of Run the Gauntlet.  Shares a hold or two with Run the Gauntlet then move left and pull straight over the bulge.  Continue up steep rock and a deep cleft.  Interesting rock and fun moves lead to a 2nd crux in a slightly overhanging corner.
content.location: Immediately to the right of Rock Junkies.  This route has a name tag at the base.

climbs.name: Run the Gauntlet
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: Climb up grey rock and a small roof to highly featured cream colored stone that looks more like limestone than basalt. Make fun and easy moves to a stance below a small roof, pull over the roof into a pod, and finish slightly right up and over a blocky ledge.

climbs.name: Rock Junkies
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: Work up overhanging rock to a small roof with an attractive clean tan and grey face. Pull on to the face with small crimps and stabby pockets. Continue up and slightly right to an obvious large hueco. Bust one more big move to easier climbing and the anchors.  Excellent sustained climb.

climbs.name: Rock Head
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: Climb up grey rock and through a blocky section.  Finish on good brown rock.

climbs.name: Ramble On
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle; 2020

content.description: Face climb up featured rock avoiding the hard deep 'v' slot.  Move right to a stance. May share a hold or two with Black Magic then move left to a corner.  Continue more or less straight up steep rock.  Make a couple thin crimps on a brown face to gain the anchors.
content.location: Immediately left of the start of Black Magic.  Look for the name tag at the base.

climbs.name: Miss Trixie
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: Lie back and stem a short face to a big ledge.  Step across to excellent rock and technical moves leading to an exciting finish on a pocketed face.

climbs.name: Head Stone
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: Follow a right trending line through a couple of small roofs to an anchor high on the wall near the rim.

climbs.name: Déjà Vu
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle; FA by Supe Vitali; 2017

content.description: The start is about 100 feet right of Coffin Nails.  Climb the deep, dark corner on excellent stone. Face climb and hand jam to the anchors.

climbs.name: Dune
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: Start behind a large tree and follow a series of steep blocks to the rim.

climbs.name: DOPAPOD
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: Start with big moves through an overhang just off the ground. Work up and slightly left trending through 3 more small roofs with a cruxy move or two (or three) at each roof.

climbs.name: Demon Monkey
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: Start on an overhanging boulder and climb up into a deep corner. Pull the left side of a roof past and face climb over the monkey face (the eye sockets make great undercling holds). Continue up through 2 more roofs and manage a very thin move below the anchors.

climbs.name: Coffin Nails
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: Climb up low angle stacked blocks to a bolt in vertical rock. Work up a series of corners to a big roof and pull it on the left side to gain a stance. Move up and left to the anchors on Chain Smoker.  It's worth putting up with the scruffy but easy start as the finish has excellent movement on great rock.

climbs.name: Seismic Event
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description:
,

Just right of a blank tan face, climb a bulge and gain an obvious crack.  Continue up, passing a roof on its right and another roof on the left.  Finish on a steep brown face.

climbs.name: Chain Smoker
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle; FA:  Terran Engle

content.description: Start on a slab with 2 bolts, gain a stance and step right around a corner and climb the surprisingly tough face and arête. Continue to a pair of roofs that lead to a big corner below the cedar tree on the rim.

climbs.name: Burly Girl
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle; FA:  Terran Engle

content.description:
Shares the opening move with

Block Party

then move right up a ramp to a big roof.  Pull the roof with big moves and wild stemming.  Move up to the final overlap and jam through the roof to a brown face with sloping holds. Make a tough move to the anchors.

climbs.name: Block Party
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: Start in the middle of a cream/tan colored face.  Climb to a crack that turns left and into a burly undercling.  Pull the bulge to a stance.  Continue up a crack/corner on good rock.

climbs.name: Blackout
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: Starts in finely grained and featured grey rock. Pull the roof just off the ground with pockets, edges and big moves. Continue up through a couple more slightly easier roofs and overlaps.

climbs.name: Black Magic
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: Start on a nice pillar like feature and follow a slightly left trending line through a couple of small roofs to a crux finish below the anchors.

climbs.name: Avalanche
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: Climb through a series of gaping overlaps to a thin tricky crux move below the anchors.

climbs.name: A Stone’s Throw Away
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: Start on the left side of a prominent triangular roof and follow bolts to the anchor.
